description:
T1.  Lime  -  Reduce higher stem by 2m to suitable growth points and reshape retaining secondary lateral growth to furnish.  Thin remaining canopy 40% by the selective removal of epicormic shoots.  Lift Canopy to 4m from ground level.
T3.  Lime  -  Reduce in height by 2m to suitable growth points and reshape retaining secondary lateral growth to furnish.  thin remaining canopy 40% by the selective removal of epicormic shoots.  Lift canopy to 4m from ground level.
T8.  Lime -  Reduce in height back to previous points of reduction and reshape retaining secondary lateral growth to furnish.  Thin remaining canopy 40% by the selective removal of epicormic shoots.  Lift canopy to 4m from ground level.
T10. Lime  -  Reduce back eastern stem by 1-2m to suitable growth points and reshape retaining secondary lateral growth to furnish.  Thin remaining canopy 40% by the selective removal of epicormic shoots.  Lift canopy to 4m from ground level. 
T15. Lime  -  Crown shape to maintain continuous canopy outlined.  Lift to 4m.
T19. London Plane  -  Crown lift to 6m from ground level on east side as best as practically possible with long arm lopers and ladder.  
T21. Lime  -  Reduce height of selective stems by 1-2m to suitable growth points and reshape retaining secondary lateral growth to furnish.  Lift canopy to 4m from ground level.
T23. Black Poplar  -  Remove eastern co-dominant stem by 2m.  Lift epicormic shoots to 5m from ground level over road.
T24. Lime  -  Crown shape to maintain continuous canopy outline.  Thin remaining canopy 40% by the selective removal of epicormic shoots.  Lift canopy to 4m from ground level.
T25. Lime  -  Reduce higher stem by 2m to suitable growth points and reshape retaining secondary lateral growth to furnish.  Thin remaining canopy 40% by the selective removal of epicormic shoots.  Lift canopy to 4m from ground level.
